name: Cape Grace

reviews.text: Without a doubt, this hotel deserves a good rating, but my experience was both a notch below my expectations and a notch below what I've come to expect from properties that attain a score of 95 or above in Conde Nast Gold List ratings. That score is lofty and elusive for most of the world's properties and I've come to associate it with virtual perfection, which wasn't my Cape Grace experience.
reviews.title: Certainly Very Good....But Short of Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I pulled up to the hotel, driving a Benz rental car, I had to get out and engage the doormen, though they were only chatting among themselves and not busy, and much of my stay mirrored that service flaw.....no dinner menus available at 6:00 pm, no one at the travel desk to answer questions, no one at the cashier's desk at check-out time, generally amazing rooms, but marred with a few cheap elements not customary to ultra-luxury properties.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, the decor of the common areas is outstanding, the food at Signal absolutely superb, the spa service wonderful, the baths luxurious and faultless, and the responses to my concerns gracious and timely. All in all, the hotel is very good but as a Virtuoso traveller, service just fell too far short when one considers the high price point of the room and the comparatively low cost of staffing in South Africa. My experience may well have been a rare hiccup, but I'd choose another property when returning to Cape Town....perhaps the Twelve Apostles, especially since I preferred the coasts and beaches to the city.
reviews.title: Its Expensive - but...
Best Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed in some great hotels around the world and this is right up there. The rooms were beautiful and full of what you would expect. The Spa was excellent (we had 2 massages in our stay - with Table Mountainin the background) The location couldn't be better - on the Waterfront but also a 10 minute walk from the City Centre. However, the best thing about this hotel was the service. From the moment we checked in, every staff member said 'Good Morning' to you - we had a 'guest liason' manager who organised everything for us with no fuss and utmost professionalism. If you like luxury then this is your place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A truely great hotel in a superb location. It is pricey - at least for the rooms, but it has so much to offer.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot praise this hotel enough!! It was the first stop on our 3 week S.A. trip and was a joy to stay in. The hotel is beautifully decorated having been recently renovated, all the staff are wonderful - very friendly and so helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The staff at the front desk were very helpful in recommending and booking dinner reservations and a great added touch was the hotel's complimentary chauffer service which we used to drop us off and pick us up from our dinner reservations.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel, Wonderful Service

reviews.text: The a la carte breakfast was very good and it was lovely to sit over-looking the marina and table mountain. Location of the hotel is fantastic right on the V&A Waterfront. You can also get tickets for table mountain from the desk in the reception and avoid the queues at tale mountain ticket office.
reviews.title: A definate Grace!

reviews.text: This hotel is definitely one of the best city hotels we have stayed in.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
Graceful excellence
reviews.text: I stayed at The Grace for my recent birthday, and had my expections exceeded from the time i walked through the front door!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and i were booked on an early flight into town and arrived at the hotel super early. We were advised that our room was not ready but they would work on it! This was not a problem as i was aware the room might not be ready and went for a walk. Not even 30 mins later, i got the call saying that the room was ready, and i may check in.
reviews.title: Best hotel we've ever stayed in! Perfect for Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband says its the best place he has ever stayed. With 100 countries under his belt that is a compliment.
reviews.title: once in a life time...

reviews.text: Beautiful exquisite hotel. The staff were very pleasant, friendly and eager to help.
reviews.title: Extraordinary and on the edge of perfection

reviews.text: Room: we stayed in the president suite, which was the size of a small apt. in some countries. It was one of those hotels you could just stay at and Not leave.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in every way!!!

reviews.text: I'm sure all rooms had a wonderful view. Ours had a superb view of the marina.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Designed down to the last detail. Even the breakfast menu was creatively designed.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the holiday to South Africa was to celebrate my 60th birthday I wanted to have a memorable time and stay somewhere special, I could not have booked a better hotel in Cape Town.
reviews.title: Fabulous… superb service and great location

reviews.text: Cape Grace is situated in a great location adjacent to the marina with stunning views of Table Mountain and a short walk to the vibrant waterfront with hundreds of shops and restaurants. We felt safe walking even at night with a high visibility of security present.
reviews.title: Better Than Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cape Grace is a fabulous hotel beautifully decorated with smiling friendly staff. Wherever we went in the hotel or whatever question we asked nothing was too much trouble and everyone went the extra special mile to give exemplary service especially Tanya Wall ( senior guest liaison) who greeted us at check in and took care of our every need during our stay.
reviews.title: Very good 5 star hotel - location could not be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious, comfortable with every home comfort and terrific views over the yacht marina and Table Mountain. A giant plasma TV could be watched from a 3 seater settee and two comfy arm chairs. A writing desk and chair was separate from a dining table with four chairs lit by a majestic chandelier. A side table had four decanters of sherry , whiskey, brandy and port. The bathroom was vast with separate shower and bath, twin sinks and separate WC. The toiletries were Charlotte Rhys and even had shaving cream. Numerous thick and soft towers were provided with additional separate ones for the swimming pool or our terrace Jacuzzi. The large bedroom with its very comfy king size bed had a walk in wardrobe with plenty of hanging space , shelves and a room safe. Another giant plasma TV was housed on a cabinet with more storage space. The bedroom, bathroom and lounge all had French doors leading onto a balcony or terrace with fantastic views over the marina and Table Mountain. If you want the best experience Cape Grace is “THE “ venue. One of the best hotels I have stayed in around the world
reviews.title: Top Notch Service!

reviews.text: This would have been our 4th stay at The Cape Grace, but our first since the new look, all we can say is "WOW" !!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Service, So-So Food

aka: Cape Grace Hotel Cape Town Central
description: Nestled on a private quay between the working harbour of Cape Town’s bustling Victoria & Alfred Waterfront and the serenity of an international yacht marina, Cape Grace is a welcoming and gracious sanctuary of tradition, sophistication and contemporary comfort.
